intro: Dichrocephala macrocephala, commonly known as the large-headed dichrocephala, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow flowers with a distinctive two-toned appearance, giving it its scientific name. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its adaptability in various habitats.
